TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit KeyChain extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: The KeyChain class provides access to private keys and their corresponding certificate chains in credential storage.

remarks.para: The KeyChain class provides access to private keys and their corresponding certificate chains in credential storage.

Applications accessing the KeyChain normally go through these steps:
Receive a callback from an that a private key is requested.
Call to allow the user to select from a list of currently available private keys and corresponding certificate chains. The chosen alias will be returned by the callback , or null if no private key is available or the user cancels the request.
Call and to retrieve the credentials to return to the corresponding callbacks.

An application may remember the value of a selected alias to avoid prompting the user with on subsequent connections. If the alias is no longer valid, null will be returned on lookups using that value

An application can request the installation of private keys and certificates via the Intent provided by . Private keys installed via this Intent will be accessible via while Certificate Authority (CA) certificates will be trusted by all applications through the default X509TrustManager.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Broadcast Action: Indicates the trusted storage has changed.

remarks.para:
Broadcast Action: Indicates the trusted storage has changed. Sent when one of this happens:
a new CA is added,
an existing CA is removed or disabled,
a disabled CA is enabled,
trusted storage is reset (all user certs are cleared),
when permission to access a private key is changed.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ChoosePrivateKeyAlias (Android.App.Activity activity, Android.Security.IKeyChainAliasCallback response, string[] keyTypes, Java.Security.IPrincipal[] issuers, string host, int port, string alias);

.method public static hidebysig void ChoosePrivateKeyAlias(class Android.App.Activity activity, class Android.Security.IKeyChainAliasCallback response, string[] keyTypes, class Java.Security.IPrincipal[] issuers, string host, int32 port, string alias) cil managed

Docs.param: The context to use for launching the new sub-Activity to prompt the user to select a private key; used only to call startActivity(); must not be null.
Callback to invoke when the request completes; must not be null
The acceptable types of asymmetric keys such as "RSA" or "DSA", or a null array.
The acceptable certificate issuers for the certificate matching the private key, or null.
The host name of the server requesting the certificate, or null if unavailable.
The port number of the server requesting the certificate, or -1 if unavailable.
The alias to preselect if available, or null if unavailable.
Docs.summary: Launches an Activity for the user to select the alias for a private key and certificate pair for authentication.

remarks.para: Launches an Activity for the user to select the alias for a private key and certificate pair for authentication. The selected alias or null will be returned via the KeyChainAliasCallback callback.
The device or profile owner can intercept this before the activity is shown, to pick a specific private key alias.
keyTypes and issuers may be used to highlight suggested choices to the user, although to cope with sometimes erroneous values provided by servers, the user may be able to override these suggestions.
host and port may be used to give the user more context about the server requesting the credentials.
alias allows the chooser to preselect an existing alias which will still be subject to user confirmation.

a.href: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/security/KeyChain.html#choosePrivateKeyAlias(android.app.Activity, android.security.KeyChainAliasCallback, java.lang.String[], java.security.Principal[], java.lang.String, int, java.lang.String)

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Android.Content.Intent CreateInstallIntent() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an Intent that can be used for credential installation.

remarks.para: Returns an Intent that can be used for credential installation. The intent may be used without any extras, in which case the user will be able to install credentials from their own source.

Alternatively, or maybe used to specify the bytes of an X.509 certificate or a PKCS#12 key store for installation. These extras may be combined with to provide a default alias name for credentials being installed.
When used with , will be returned if a credential was successfully installed, otherwise will be returned.

Docs.summary: Optional extra to specify an X.509 certificate to install on the Intent returned by .

remarks.para: Optional extra to specify an X.509 certificate to install on the Intent returned by . The extra value should be a PEM or ASN.1 DER encoded byte[]. An can be converted to DER encoded bytes with .
may be used to provide a default alias name for the installed certificate.

Docs.summary: Optional extra to specify a String credential name on the Intent returned by .

remarks.para: Optional extra to specify a String credential name on the Intent returned by .

Docs.summary: Optional extra for use with the Intent returned by to specify a PKCS#12 key store to install.

remarks.para: Optional extra for use with the Intent returned by to specify a PKCS#12 key store to install. The extra value should be a byte[]. The bytes may come from an external source or be generated with on a "PKCS12" instance.
The user will be prompted for the password to load the key store.
The key store will be scanned for entries and both the private key and associated certificate chain will be installed.
may be used to provide a default alias name for the installed credentials.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Java.Security.Cert.X509Certificate[] GetCertificateChain (Android.Content.Context context, string alias);
.method public static hidebysig class Java.Security.Cert.X509Certificate[] GetCertificateChain(class Android.Content.Context context, string alias) cil managed

Docs.param: The alias of the desired certificate chain, typically returned via .
Docs.summary: Returns the X509Certificate chain for the requested alias, or null if no there is no result.

remarks.para: Returns the X509Certificate chain for the requested alias, or null if no there is no result.
This method may block while waiting for a connection to another process, and must never be called from the main thread.

Docs.exception: if the alias was valid but there was some problem accessing it.
if called from the main thread.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsBoundKeyAlgorithm(string algorithm) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns true if the current device's KeyChain binds any PrivateKey of the given algorithm to the device once imported or generated.

remarks.para: Returns true if the current device's KeyChain binds any PrivateKey of the given algorithm to the device once imported or generated. This can be used to tell if there is special hardware support that can be used to bind keys to the device in a way that makes it non-exportable.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool IsKeyAlgorithmSupported(string algorithm) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns true if the current device's KeyChain supports a specific PrivateKey type indicated by algorithm (e.g.

remarks.para: Returns true if the current device's KeyChain supports a specific PrivateKey type indicated by algorithm (e.g., "RSA").

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
